algorithm_technique: Use Depth First Search (DFS) to explore all possible paths from the source node to the target node in a DAG.
problem_summary_simple: Find all possible paths from node 0 to node n-1 in a directed acyclic graph.
problem_summary_technical: Employs a recursive DFS traversal to explore all paths in a directed acyclic graph, collecting paths that reach the target node.
key_insights: DFS is a natural fit for pathfinding problems in graphs.
Backtracking (using `path.pop()`) is essential to explore alternative paths.
The graph is guaranteed to be a DAG, simplifying the DFS as there are no cycles to worry about.
